tags: steve likes Iron Man or Tony identity porn masterlist
summary: Do you have any identity porn where specifically Steve likes Iron Man but doesn't like Tony?
question: Do you have any identity porn where specifically Steve likes Iron Man but doesn't like Tony?
answer:
Ahhhh, identity porn!  Who doesn’t love those.  Especially with the added angst, amirite?  Not all of these are where Steve like hates Tony or IM, just where he’s way more into the alter ego, let’s say, but hopefully you will find something you like.  Here are some suggestions for you:

YOUR ALTER EGO WOULD LEAVE COMMENTS AND KUDOS FOR YOUR AUTHORS!

Identity Porn where Steve falls for Iron Man

Detours in Getting to Yes by @msermesth: Tony is trying hard to stay sober by throwing himself into his work and leading the Avengers. At the same time, Steve moves to Brooklyn Heights in an attempt to find himself after Sharon’s death.Which means it’s a great time for the two of them to get in an argument about Stark International’s new Brooklyn facility and for Steve to realize he’s in love with Iron Man.

A Problem of Identity by @cptxrogers: Steve knows he and Iron Man could be happy together if only Iron Man’s obnoxious boss, Mr. Stark, would stop getting in the way.

At the Heart of the Matter by Pookaseraph: Tony didn’t mean to become Steve’s BFF and the greatest thorn in his side at the same time, it just sort of happened. In a world where Tony Stark didn’t come out as Iron Man, he has managed to keep his identity a closely guarded secret, even from many of his teammates… the only problem is Steve Rogers seems to be falling for Iron Man, and he doesn’t much care for Tony Stark.

Hypotenuse by derryderrydown: Steve breaks up with Tony because he’s in love with Iron Man. That’s when things start to get complicated.

Can’t Let You See by TheCityLightShow: Despite what the media says, Tony Stark is no stranger to love – actual love, he means, not just lust and loneliness numbed with alcohol and a warm body. (He’s all too familiar with that.) He loves being Iron Man, being an Avenger. Even if no one else knows that it’s him. Most of all, Tony Stark loves Steve Rogers: and ain’t that the kicker? Because Steve Rogers – All-American, patient-yet-snarky, inherently good and sinfully handsome Steve Rogers – is in love with Iron Man.Some days, Tony really hates his life.

Sucker Punch by @sineala: Steve never quite warms to Tony Stark, Avengers benefactor. The Molecule Man never strips Iron Man out of his armor. Life goes on for the Avengers, but as disagreements split the team – and Shellhead and Winghead – again and again, Steve wonders why Iron Man always picks Tony over him. And when Steve finds out, it happens in the worst way possible.

Think of This as Solving Problems (That Never Should Have Occurred) by @sineala: No one knows Tony is Iron Man. Then Tony gets amnesia, and literally no one knows Tony is Iron Man.

To Make Much of Time by @sineala: When Iron Man rejects Steve’s romantic advances, Steve is disappointed, but of course he understands – Iron Man’s secret identity is important. But when a portal opens and Tony Stark crashes into their midst from twelve years in the future, Steve starts to suspect that there are more secrets here than he can even begin to comprehend, and neither Iron Man nor Tony are providing any answers.

Reputation by copperbadge: Steve thinks Iron Man is trading sexual favors to Tony Stark for perks for the Avengers, and he’s determined to protect his teammate.

Nobody Does it Better by @blossomsinthemist:  Steve frowned, and reached out with his still gloved hand, but he stopped before his hand reached Tony’s gauntleted forearm, and then he just stood there, looking at Tony, a strange, wistful, yearning but somehow determined look on his face. “What,” he said. “Not supposed to be your friend? Well, too late, Tin Man.” Steve’s in love with Iron Man.  Tony’s in love with Steve.  The only problem is a little matter of identity.  Early 616 canon identity porn Steve/Iron Man get together fic.

I’ll Give You Gifts Until You Know My Name by Amuly @everybodyilovedies: Mr. Stark is an extravagant gift-giver: he has the money for it, after all. As Iron Man, Tony has the opportunity to gift Steve even more presents that, while less expensive, are more heartfelt. Having a secret identity means Tony gets to have his cake and eat it too when it comes to showering Steve with presents.Until Steve starts developing feelings for his armored companion, and all the benefits of living a double life are turned on their head for Tony Stark.

in the one garden you may call your own by Woad: It was probably the height of arrogance, helping Steve woo himself. But what could Tony do? Steve was right, there was no one else who knew the Golden Avenger better.Steve enlists Tony to help him tell Iron Man how he feels.

when he’s not here by @navaanwrites: Iron Man is gone and Steve misses him

Blind Date Identity Porn AU by sabrecmc:  Steve has a crush on Iron Man.  Tony has a crush on Captain America. Steve isn’t too impressed by Tony Stark, or so he thinks.  This Thank You Fic request was for a blind date AU where Pepper and Natasha set them up.  I went with the premise that Tony never revealed himself as Iron Man and no one knows Captain America’s true identity, so double identity porn, whee!!!

Identity Porn where Steve falls for Tony

Intrepid Hearts by @captainneverever: Tony hangs around the mansion more after Steve is seriously hurt in an explosion caused by Iron Man. Steve likes Tony but doesn’t know why Tony is upset all the time. Maybe Iron Man is the problem.

Every Villain is a Hero (Is His Own Mind) by @awesomeavocadolove: Tony is the villain known as Iron Man. Steve is Captain America. Outside work, Steve and Tony are married and do not know each other’s secret identities. Some revelations, though, do not come with a happy ending.

Telling Truth Behind My Own Mask by irondorkness: Iron Man is the bodyguard of the Avengers benefactor and mechanic, Tony Stark.Unfortunately, he tends to voice rather unpleasant opinions about his employer, which grates Steve’s gears quite a bit.Steve thinks Tony is just great and doesn’t deserve the harsh critizism from someone like Iron Man.

Many Faces, All of Them Yours by @cptxrogers: Steve is head over heels for the team’s benefactor Tony, but he feels terrible for his best friend, Iron Man, who seems to have developed a bit of a crush on him. And now there’s a mysterious new hero, Nomad, stalking the streets of New York.An identity porn soap opera.

Eavesdroppers Never by @sineala: When Tony made the decision to have a secret identity, he had several well-considered and carefully thought-out reasons. But there were a few scenarios he never took into account. He never imagined that he, Iron Man, would be cuddling naked with Captain America in a Canadian shack in the middle of a snowstorm. He also never imagined that Captain America would pick that moment to tell him, Iron Man, about his feelings for Tony Stark. Uh-oh.

If You’d Only Knew by SouldierToTheEnd:  “Captain, I thought I told you to call me ‘Tony.’”  Steve’s grin quickly faded once Stark turned around.He paled. “Mister Stark, your eye!“ After seeing Tony riddled with bruises and Iron Man being evasive, Steve assumes the worst.

Who You Think You Are by Tahruil: In a world where no one knows the identity of Iron Man, Tony Stark is the best thing since sliced bread, at least in the opinion of one Steve Rogers. He doesn’t like to let anyone know that - especially not Tony - but one day it sort of slips out. Luckily it’s only to his best friend, and Shellhead won’t tell anyone. What could possibly go wrong?

Bizarre Love Triangle by panicyintheuk: Once the idea was in his head, he’d started picking up on all kinds of things, like the way Stark talked about Iron Man with such affection, and seemed to share so many of his mannerisms, and was constantly working on ways of improving the suit. It was obvious.

To the End of Love by @laireshi: Steve’s been married to Tony for years when the Stamford disaster happens and the Superhero Registration Act tears the superhero community apart. When Tony disagrees with Steve, Steve still expects Iron Man to follow him: he’s his best friend, for one, and he’s chosen to keep his identity a secret from everyone. But Iron Man also fights against him.And then Steve smashes his faceplate open.

He doesn’t like to let anyone know that - especially not Tony - but one day it sort of slips out. Luckily it’s only to his best friend, and Shellhead won’t tell anyone. What could possibly go wrong?

Bizarre Love Triangle by panicyintheuk: Once the idea was in his head, he’d started picking up on all kinds of things, like the way Stark talked about Iron Man with such affection, and seemed to share so many of his mannerisms, and was constantly working on ways of improving the suit. It was obvious.

To the End of Love by @laireshi: Steve’s been married to Tony for years when the Stamford disaster happens and the Superhero Registration Act tears the superhero community apart. When Tony disagrees with Steve, Steve still expects Iron Man to follow him: he’s his best friend, for one, and he’s chosen to keep his identity a secret from everyone. But Iron Man also fights against him.And then Steve smashes his faceplate open.

body:
Blank

this is based on those headcanons on what happens to those who got dusted or get dusted. 

@we-love-tony-stark-wednesday

Word count: short

Tony Stark was born on May 29th in the year 1970. He went to MIT when he was 15 and started to run Stark Industries shortly after his parents died. Tony Stark was held in captivity for three months in the year 2008. After he was rescued, he stopped making weapons and become a superhero known as Iron Man. This is all information that can be easily gathered from a high school textbook, hell this is a basic summary of the man’s Wikipedia page.

So why can’t anyone remember him? Why couldn’t Peter? 

 Peter sat in the middle of his floor, the pictures he had found were scattered around him. They all had the man in them, Peter was even in some, but as Peter looked around at the hundreds of pictures around him, as he looked at the man’s face no sense of familiarity passed through him, only a gut-wrenching feeling of sadness. 

 The feeling soon made him start to cry. Silently at first until they quickly turned into loud sobs as he stared at the man until his shaking hands and watery eyes made it hard to see. 

 Why was he crying? 

 Why was he so sad? 

 Who was he? 

 “Why can’t I remember you?”

title: Light [9]
body:
Pairing: Avengers X Reader / Dad!Tony X Reader

Warnings: sweating panics attacks, mention of past child abuse, mention of torture  

Words count: 3,386

Summary: When one of the Avengers finds a girl fleeing from her past, her only option is to trust them to help her. What they did not know was that this decision would change everyone’s life forever. Especially Tony’s.

A/N: Oh, man! It’s being a while, let’s blame tumblr for it. And I got a beter reader!! A huge thanks to @emygirl! You’re awesome dude! Btw, I’m really proud of this chapter. Remember to tell me what ya think via asks. Stay awesome gotham!

series masterlist || ch. 1 || ch. 2 || ch. 3 || ch. 4 || ch. 5 || ch. 6 || ch. 7 || ch. 8

You didn’t remember the last time you felt so alone. It had been five days, and Mr. Stark hadn’t spoken to you since then. Part of you knew he couldn’t, the lawyer you forgot the name of told you that you couldn’t speak with Mr. Stark for a while because that could “interfere in the proceedings”.

But most of all, you’re scared. What if Mr. Stark didn’t want you and you would have to live with Arthur and Elizabeth again? You wouldn’t even get in the front door before they would you for escaping and ending up living with the avengers of all people.

You sighs and looks at your watch. Friday hadn’t spoken to you since, but the watch are still working. If it wasn’t for that, you could swear it was all just a dream. You would swear you never had a family again.

The truth is, you’re starting to doubt, and it sucks because maybe the feelings they had for you was just pity. Maybe they never saw you as you saw them. Maybe you just made yourself a fool again, maybe you was nothing but the homeless and starving girl Loki found. You couldn’t help but start to feel tears coming.

The pain is so strong and you missed them so much, it seemed it would kill you.  All you wanted was to go back and play Monopoly and have movie nights with them. Hear Peter talk about Star Wars and spend almost all night with Mr. Stark in the lab, hearing him murmur a song that Friday was playing, too concentrated on what he was doing to notice you hiding a smile. Or even stay up reading with Pepper or see Loki’s magic and learn self-defence with Buck.

Bucky.

You touches the bracelet he gave you, feeling a tear fall.

This will protect me.

“Y/N?” you hear Natalie, the woman you’re staying with, knock on the door. “I brought you lunch.”

You don’t move from the window you’re sitting in, just looking at the heavy clouds of the storm that was about to come.

Natalie peeks in with her head and looks at the sad girl watching the rain. She enters, biting her lip and put the tray on the table and walked towards you.

“Hi.”

You don’t move.

“I made chicken…” still no response. “Aren’t you hungry? You didn’t eat anything since yesterday… you’ll end up sick.”

She sit next to you looking for the your eyes. “Or maybe get out of this room? You’ve just stayed  here since you arrived… Earth to Hope…are you in there?” She waves her hand lightly in front of your face. Nothing. She shifts in the same spot, still biting her lips. “Look… I know you’re sad and you miss… them, but you can’t stay like this honey…”

You don’t move, just keep sitting there, and with that light, you look almost lifeless.

“Okay…” Natalie says, giving up on trying to get something from you. “I’ll leave the plate here. If you want something… Just… Just let me know.”

She walks slowly to the door, and, before she closed it she looks at you again.

You really seems like a ghost.

—

Tony is sitting on the dinner table looking at the security footage of the cameras in the tower, smiling like a fool at seeing they play monopoly together.

Tony never thought he was this kind of guy, but he was. Peter and you had made him like that.

He misses you. The house seems so empty without you, and everyone noticed. A part of the family was missing. A member, and it seemed like they had lost you.  

He wants his baby girl back. He want you next to him. That is the only way he could protect you.

“You want me to talk to her, boss?” Friday asks him, almost worried.

“No, Fri. We can’t. Matt said it… it isn’t good.”

“Are you really going to take her, Tony?” Friday asks, her accent stronger than before.

“Of course. There’s no way I would let her be by herself anymore.” Tony pause the footage on a frame of  you smiling.

He couldn’t imagine how you’re doing. The worry is keeping him up at night. It was like… it was like someone had taken his kid.

“Tony?” Tony looks behind him and saw Bucky leaning against the wall with a serious face. “You have a minute?”

Tony look away and close the hologram. “Sure. What’s up?”

He come closer and sit on the chair beside Tony. A little awkward moment passes between them but they ignored it. It wasn’t the time to bring up the past.

“Do you have new news?” Bucky asks.

“Uh, no. Just old ones. Her father, Arthur is with his lawyers and they’re investigating her home abuse and… she’s with a lady called Natalie… Matt is coming with the decision about the guard. Now it's…we just wait.”

Tony hate to wait. It’s out of his control and he hate it.

“Well… it's… about that, that I wanted to talk to you.” Bucky begin carefully, directing all Tony’s attention to him.

“Okay. I’m listening.”

“Well, you noticed Y/ N and I became close. That’s because we… talked. Not… not exactly. I talked and… she listened. One night I came here to get a glass of water and she was crying. I came closer and sat besides her. And, for a moment she didn’t look at me, she just keep crying. At some point she stopped and finally looked at me and… I said “I get it. We’ve all  been there.” She looked at me, almost challenging me, like she said: “Oh yeah? You’ve been through this?” and showed me some black marks on her arms.  Tony… I know those marks. It’s from a kind of torture with ropes. She’s been tortured, Tony. A kid. Our Y/N.”

Bucky bring his hands to his face and looks back at Tony, who are horrified.

Tony didn’t wanted to imagine how Bucky knew this, or how you got those.

“You can’t let her go back there. She’s just a kid. An… innocent kid. She doesn’t deserve it.”

“I won’t.” Tony says with determination. “She will never go back there.”

Bucky looks into Tony’s eyes and see that he meant it. He wouldn’t let you, and that was enough for him.

“Okay.” Bucky says, nodding.

“Okay.” Tony replies, looking away.

Bucky stays there just for another minute before he get up and starts to walk away.

“Barnes?” Tony calls and Bucky turns around. “I’m glad she talked to you.”

Bucky just smiles and nods, walking away right after.

Yeah, maybe they would heal.

—

“Boss? Matt’s here.” Friday says.

Tony sighs heavily.

“Let him in.”

He wait a few minutes in silence with his head bowed low trying to prepare himself for whatever news Matt had.

“Mr. Stark?” Matt calls.

Tony looks up at him.

“Can I sit?”

“Sure.” He looks at the hologram again and feel his heart squeeze.

Matt moves slowly towards him and sit heavily in the chair.

“So, Tony. They’ve come to a decision.” Matt says with a serious tone.

They’ll take her from me, Tony thought

“They’ve allowed her to stay with you  provisionally. But, since you want to become her legal guardian, a family court will have to meet to appoint you as such. That day isn’t confirmed yet, but it should be soon. You can go pick her up now Tony. You can bring Y/N home.” Matt says with a smile.

“What?” Tony asks with wide eyes. “They really… they’ll let me keep her?”

“Well, as I said, you’ll have the provisional guardianship, and she’ll have to go to school. You have to proof to them that she can be well treated and have a normal life.” Matt explained.

“That’s no problem. I-I can put her in the same school as Peter. He can help her.” He spoke fast, gesturing with his hands.

“That would be great. We don’t know exactly how long it will take for them to come to a conclusion.”

“Yeah, yeah! Great!” He stand up, smiling broadly “I’ll go pick her up now. The lady knows about -”

“Tony.” Matt interrupts him with a serious face that took Tony smile away. “I have to warn you, that guy, her father, he’s not a good person.”

“Yeah. Tell about it. How could a man who tortures his little girl be a good person.” Tony says with a cold voice.

“Torture?” Matt raises an eyebrow.

“Bucky told me he saw marks on Hope’s arms, and that he knew what caused those kinds of marks. It’s a kind of torture with ropes… God, I don’t wanna imagine what else this kid suffered.” Tony closes his eyes, trying not to think about his kid crying in pain at Arthur’s hands.

“That’ll be good for the court proceedings” Matt says as he nodded. “But that’s not what I’m talking about. The man was furious, Tony. He’s… Dangerous. And his wife isn’t much different. We have to be careful, for y/n sake.”

“I know. We will.” Tony says with intensity, and Matt knew that he meant it.

He leans back in the chair again and smiled. “What are you waiting for? Go get her.”

Tony smiles and almost ran out of the room.

“Friday, if someone asks for me, tell them what happened. Oh! And thank Matt for me.”

“Got it, Boss.” Friday replies with a cheerful voice.

Tony would finally see you again and be able to protect you.

How could he ever think of leaving you in the hands of strangers? He couldn’t imagine their lives without you now. Or no monopoly afternoons, or movie nights with Pepper, Peter and you. Life before the arrival of the sweet, quiet girl who arrived at Tony’s house weeks ago seemed distant and unreal to him. 

He parks out in front of the large house and took a deep breath. It’s big and comfortable. It’s a good place for you but, it isn’t right.

He stepped out of the car and walks towards the front door. He pauses for a moment, holding his breath, and then knocks on the door.

Seconds passes before a blond woman with kind eyes opens the door.  A shocked expression spread across her face.

“Good afternoon, Mrs. Lopez. I’m here to bring Hope home.” Tony says with a kind smile as he saw the woman’s expression change to relief.

“Oh, thank God!” Natalie says as she brings her hands to her chest.

“Why? What’s wrong with her?” Tony smile rapidly fades away to a  worried expression.

“She won’t eat or leave her room, ..  she’s so sad… And I don’t know what to do.” She says with a guilty expression.

“Take me to her.” Tony says, entering in the house.

They walks in silence until they reaches your door’s. Natalie opens it slowly and sighs sadly upon seeing that the food she brought earlier was still there, untouched. She stepped aside to let Tony enter the room..

“Y/n? There’s someone here to see you.”

You suddenly froze. It was Arthur, wasn’t it? He would take you. He would hurt you again.

“Hey there.” Tony says lightly as he walks towards you slowly.

You’re sure it’s your mind tricking you. You’re hallucinating. Mr. Stark wasn’t there. The moment you turn around, it was going to be Arthur standing there with that smile.

I’m fucked.

You turn around and look at him, blinking to make the vision disappear. 

But it didn’t. 

Tony is there looking at you with a worried expression. The relief you felt was so strong that you feel tears coming almost immediately.

You run to him so fast you stumbled a bit, but Tony knelt down and caught you up in a hug which prevented you from falling

“You’re okay. You’re fine. I’ve got you. I’m here.” Tony keep repeating like a mantra in your ear, and without even realising it, you started to cry.

“Oh, baby girl.” Tony’s voice broke, his heart too. He couldn’t tell whether it was fear or your crying causing you to shake, but either way, he could feel how scared you’re. “I’m right here. I promised you, didn’t I? We going home.”   

I was so scared. I thought you would leave me. I thought that I never would see you again. I thought I would have to live with him. I thought that I would be alone again. I don’t wanna be alone anymore. Please.

You let out a small sob as you tried to breathe properly.

He took the rope with a ghostly smile on his face.

It didn’t take long for Tony to realise what was happening; You’re having a panic attack again. The realisation made Tony’s heart ache even more.

The ropes tightened around your wrists, making tears form in your eyes.

“Hey, hey kid.” Tony tried to push you an arm’s-length away, just enough to look at you, but you hold him right back.

She couldn’t make any noise. She had to stay quiet and tolerate the pain in complete silence.

“Y/n, I just want to look at you. Let me look at you kiddo.” Tony asks gently in your ear.

He left the room, leaving her there with her wrists tied and sore. God knows how long she would be there. And it hurts

“Kid, it’s not real. Whatever you’re reliving it’s not real. You’re okay. You’re with me. And you’re safe.” Tony tries to calm you down but you can’t hear him. Or breathe.

You can’t breathe. All you’re feeling was the tight ropes around you, and it hurt and you can’t breathe.

Why you can’t breathe? Why did it seem like your lungs are gone?

“Hey, hey. No. Stay with me. You’re not going to pass out on me. Breathe with me kiddo, come on. You can do it.” Tony takes a few deep exaggerated breaths for you copy.

Pass out?

Just then you realise you’re seeing black dots in the corners of your vision and your head seemed heavy, and you still can’t breathe.

“Y/n. Focus on me.” Tony spoke urgently and takes your face in his hands. You try to focus on his worried expression in front of you, but it was getting fuzzy around the edges.  

“Breathe, kiddo. Slowly. It’s okay. It’s okay now. I promise.”

It wasn’t working. Tony’s concern and the ache on his heart was only growing.

“I know you wanna go home kid, so help me, okay? You’ve got to breathe. They probably won’t let me carry you out of here unconscious.” he tried to joke. Like they could stop me if I had to.

Home.

You’re going home.

You finally found his gaze, seeing how desperate he looked.

“Breathe.” Tony said again and let out an exaggerated breath for you to copy.

In.

“We gonna play Monopoly again.”

Out.

“What movie do you wanna watch? I know Peter made you addicted to Star Wars too.”

In.

“You don’t know how much everybody misses you.”

Out. 

“That’s right kiddo. You’re doing great.”

Do it again.

Tony let out a sigh of relief when he sees you breathing normally, looking at youi with kind eyes.

“You scared me there for a second.” He tried to joke again, taking a deep breath.

You look at him, still holding him tightly.

“You okay? Ready to go home?” He asks brushing your hair away from your face.

You nods, feeling the exhaustion starting to get to you.

He get up holding your hand and helps you to stay on your feet. He quickly thanked Natalie, holding you by your shoulders and led you out of the house.

Tony helps you get in the car and walks around to the driver side. He fastened his seat belt while watching you closely. You looked exhausted.

“You okay?”

You nods and leans your head against the window of the car, too tired to open your eyes. Your body shivered as a chill ran up your spine.

Tony noticed the shiver and reached for the temperature dial on the dashboard. “Are you cold?” He asks, narrowing his eyes.

You nodded again.

Tony took off his jacket and spread it over you like a blanket.  

“Better?”

You give a small nod, almost asleep.

The relief that Tony felt no long ago, was replaced with worry as he started to drive home. The whole way to the Tower he was taking worried glances at you. You shivered from time to time and looked too pale for Tony’s liking.

He parked the car in the Tower’s underground garage and looks over at you.

“Y/n?” He called softly. “Kid, wake up. We’re here.” He touches your shoulder lightly, but you just made a noise and turns your face further into the door of the car. .

Tony signs. “I think I’ll have to carry you after all.”

He opens his door, got out, and walks to your side. He opens the door slowly, with his hand read to catch your head which had been leaning on the window. He looped one arm around your shoulders, the other under your knees, and lifted you out of the car. Tony kicked the door shut with his heel and gripped you more securely as you shifts in his arms.

“Well, I definitely can feel my age now, huh?” He mutters to himself, as he walks to the door and stepped into the elevator.

“Good afternoon, boss. Where would you like me to take you?” Friday asks.

“Y/n’s room, Fri. Quickly.” He says, looking down at you.

“Mr. Rogers requires your presence in the living room, boss.”

“Later, Friday.”  

The elevator ascended quickly, and soon you two are in your room.

He lays you on the bed and carefully covers you with warm blankets, looking at you for a moment.

She’s home. Finally. Tony thought. Everything would be fine now.

But that thought didn’t stay for long.

You shiver on your blanked, and Tony’s concern grew.

He sit on your bed and gently places his palm in your forehead, feeling the warmth and the sweat forming on your forehead.

“Shit. Friday, what’s Y/n’s temperature?”

“Y/n’s temperature it’s currely of 103.5”

Shit. Shit. Shit. Shit.

“Friday, call Bruce, tell him to get here. Now.” Tony says, throwing another blanket over you.

“It’s okay, honey. You’re gonna be okay.” Tony sit on your bed and watchs you. Your hair was sticking to your pale forehead and you breathing sounds raspy.

“Tony?” Tony hears Bruce at the door. “Tony, what’s wrong?”

Tony looks over at Bruce with concerned eyes.

“Y/n. She… She’s sick. Fever of 103,5.”

Bruce came closer and looks at you, his professional side kicking in.

“Anything else?”

“I don't… I don’t know. The lady who was with her said that she wasn’t eating or leaving her room or… Bruce do something.” Tony asks, worry evident in his voice.

“Okay, Tony. You need to calm down. I think she’s only dehydrated.” Bruce says.  He hold your wrist to take your pulse and waited a few seconds. “She’s kinda fast and thready. I think it’s best if we put her on an IV and give her fluids. I don’t know how long she went without eating or drinking anything. Let’s take her to the medlab.”

Tony nods and picks you up in the arms again. Bruce helped with the blankets, and they walked towards the medlab.

Tony placed you on the hospital bed and stepped back to let Bruce work. Tony sits in the chair next to the bed and watched Bruce hang up bags of fluid. He winced when Bruce slid the IV needle into the top of your hand.  

“She’s getting normal saline, D5W, and RL She should be fine.” Bruce says while taping the IV in place. .

“English, Bruce?”

“Saline, sugar, and salts. She’ll be fine Tony.”  

Tony let out a deep breath and nods.

“The team is waiting in the living room, Tony. They wanna know what’s happened.”

Tony looks at Hope and then to Bruce.

“Friday, let me know if anything changes with her, okay?”

“Sure thing, boss.” Friday said and he get up, still looking at you.

“Let’s go, Bruce.”

They walked together in silence until they entered the living room and questions erupted from the team. 

“Where is she?” Loki stood up and asked.

“Is she okay?” Bucky asked.

“Are they gonna let us keep her?” Peter questioned.

“How is she Tony?” Pepper came close and took his hands.

“Let him speak guys.” Steve got up and raised his hand up to call for silence. The team settled.  Steve crossed his arms. “How is she Tony?”

“She’s home.” Tony let out a deep breath. “She’s fine, just a little sick and dehydrated, nothing big. They’ll let us keep her long enough to investigate her father and she’ll have to go to school and try to have a normal life with us.”

“We’ll support you.” Wanda said without hesitation. “We’ll do everything we can to help you and her.”

“She’s right. We’re a team and we’ll work through this together.” Nat said looking confidently at him.

“Y/n is a good kid. Of course we’re gonna help.” Clint said with soft eyes and a smile.

Tony looked at each one of them and smiled, finally feeling what he hadn’t felt in a long time.

Supported.

“Thanks guys. I… I really appreciate it.”

Taglist: @dont-stop-keep-walking, @keep-a-bucket-full-of-stars, @otomelady, @benispernice @what-inspirational-name, @pachuh @purplekitten30, @sparkling-gayyy, @fandom-fangirl07 @chonisberonica @thefantomfandom, @just4muggles, @digicharr @pietrorunsforme @annacarolinafeelings @emygirl

You didn’t remember the last time you felt so alone. It had been five days, and Mr. Stark hadn’t spoken to you since then. Part of you knew he couldn’t, the lawyer you forgot the name of told you that you couldn’t speak with Mr. Stark for a while because that could “interfere in the proceedings”.

But most of all, you’re scared. What if Mr. Stark didn’t want you and you would have to live with Arthur and Elizabeth again? You wouldn’t even get in the front door before they would you for escaping and ending up living with the avengers of all people.

You sighs and looks at your watch. Friday hadn’t spoken to you since, but the watch are still working. If it wasn’t for that, you could swear it was all just a dream. You would swear you never had a family again.

[[MORE]]

The truth is, you’re starting to doubt, and it sucks because maybe the feelings they had for you was just pity. Maybe they never saw you as you saw them. Maybe you just made yourself a fool again, maybe you was nothing but the homeless and starving girl Loki found. You couldn’t help but start to feel tears coming.

The pain is so strong and you missed them so much, it seemed it would kill you.  All you wanted was to go back and play Monopoly and have movie nights with them. Hear Peter talk about Star Wars and spend almost all night with Mr. Stark in the lab, hearing him murmur a song that Friday was playing, too concentrated on what he was doing to notice you hiding a smile. Or even stay up reading with Pepper or see Loki’s magic and learn self-defence with Buck.

Bucky.

You touches the bracelet he gave you, feeling a tear fall.

This will protect me.

“Y/N?” you hear Natalie, the woman you’re staying with, knock on the door. “I brought you lunch.”

You don’t move from the window you’re sitting in, just looking at the heavy clouds of the storm that was about to come.

Natalie peeks in with her head and looks at the sad girl watching the rain. She enters, biting her lip and put the tray on the table and walked towards you.

“Hi.”

You don’t move.

“I made chicken…” still no response. “Aren’t you hungry? You didn’t eat anything since yesterday… you’ll end up sick.”

She sit next to you looking for the your eyes. “Or maybe get out of this room? You’ve just stayed  here since you arrived… Earth to Hope…are you in there?” She waves her hand lightly in front of your face. Nothing. She shifts in the same spot, still biting her lips. “Look… I know you’re sad and you miss… them, but you can’t stay like this honey…”

You don’t move, just keep sitting there, and with that light, you look almost lifeless.

“Okay…” Natalie says, giving up on trying to get something from you. “I’ll leave the plate here. If you want something… Just… Just let me know.”

She walks slowly to the door, and, before she closed it she looks at you again.

You really seems like a ghost.

—

Tony is sitting on the dinner table looking at the security footage of the cameras in the tower, smiling like a fool at seeing they play monopoly together.

Tony never thought he was this kind of guy, but he was. Peter and you had made him like that.

He misses you. The house seems so empty without you, and everyone noticed. A part of the family was missing. A member, and it seemed like they had lost you.  

He wants his baby girl back. He want you next to him. That is the only way he could protect you.

“You want me to talk to her, boss?” Friday asks him, almost worried.

“No, Fri. We can’t. Matt said it… it isn’t good.”

“Are you really going to take her, Tony?” Friday asks, her accent stronger than before.

“Of course. There’s no way I would let her be by herself anymore.” Tony pause the footage on a frame of  you smiling.

He couldn’t imagine how you’re doing. The worry is keeping him up at night. It was like… it was like someone had taken his kid.

“Tony?” Tony looks behind him and saw Bucky leaning against the wall with a serious face. “You have a minute?”

Tony look away and close the hologram. “Sure. What’s up?”

He come closer and sit on the chair beside Tony. A little awkward moment passes between them but they ignored it. It wasn’t the time to bring up the past.

“Do you have new news?” Bucky asks.

“Uh, no. Just old ones. Her father, Arthur is with his lawyers and they’re investigating her home abuse and… she’s with a lady called Natalie… Matt is coming with the decision about the guard. Now it's…we just wait.”

Tony hate to wait. It’s out of his control and he hate it.

“Well… it's… about that, that I wanted to talk to you.” Bucky begin carefully, directing all Tony’s attention to him.

“Okay. I’m listening.”

“Well, you noticed Y/ N and I became close. That’s because we… talked. Not… not exactly. I talked and… she listened. One night I came here to get a glass of water and she was crying. I came closer and sat besides her. And, for a moment she didn’t look at me, she just keep crying. At some point she stopped and finally looked at me and… I said “I get it. We’ve all  been there.” She looked at me, almost challenging me, like she said: “Oh yeah? You’ve been through this?” and showed me some black marks on her arms.  Tony… I know those marks. It’s from a kind of torture with ropes. She’s been tortured, Tony. A kid. Our Y/N.”

Bucky bring his hands to his face and looks back at Tony, who are horrified.

Tony didn’t wanted to imagine how Bucky knew this, or how you got those.

“You can’t let her go back there. She’s just a kid. An… innocent kid. She doesn’t deserve it.”

“I won’t.” Tony says with determination. “She will never go back there.”

Bucky looks into Tony’s eyes and see that he meant it. He wouldn’t let you, and that was enough for him.

“Okay.” Bucky says, nodding.

“Okay.” Tony replies, looking away.

Bucky stays there just for another minute before he get up and starts to walk away.

“Barnes?” Tony calls and Bucky turns around. “I’m glad she talked to you.”

Bucky just smiles and nods, walking away right after.

Yeah, maybe they would heal.

—

“Boss? Matt’s here.” Friday says.

Tony sighs heavily.

“Let him in.”

He wait a few minutes in silence with his head bowed low trying to prepare himself for whatever news Matt had.

“Mr. Stark?” Matt calls.

Tony looks up at him.

“Can I sit?”

“Sure.” He looks at the hologram again and feel his heart squeeze.

Matt moves slowly towards him and sit heavily in the chair.

“So, Tony. They’ve come to a decision.” Matt says with a serious tone.

They’ll take her from me, Tony thought

“They’ve allowed her to stay with you  provisionally. But, since you want to become her legal guardian, a family court will have to meet to appoint you as such. That day isn’t confirmed yet, but it should be soon. You can go pick her up now Tony. You can bring Y/N home.” Matt says with a smile.

“What?” Tony asks with wide eyes. “They really… they’ll let me keep her?”

“Well, as I said, you’ll have the provisional guardianship, and she’ll have to go to school. You have to proof to them that she can be well treated and have a normal life.” Matt explained.

“That’s no problem. I-I can put her in the same school as Peter. He can help her.” He spoke fast, gesturing with his hands.

“That would be great. We don’t know exactly how long it will take for them to come to a conclusion.”

“Yeah, yeah! Great!” He stand up, smiling broadly “I’ll go pick her up now. The lady knows about -”

“Tony.” Matt interrupts him with a serious face that took Tony smile away. “I have to warn you, that guy, her father, he’s not a good person.”

“Yeah. Tell about it. How could a man who tortures his little girl be a good person.” Tony says with a cold voice.

“Torture?” Matt raises an eyebrow.

“Bucky told me he saw marks on Hope’s arms, and that he knew what caused those kinds of marks. It’s a kind of torture with ropes… God, I don’t wanna imagine what else this kid suffered.” Tony closes his eyes, trying not to think about his kid crying in pain at Arthur’s hands.

“That’ll be good for the court proceedings” Matt says as he nodded. “But that’s not what I’m talking about. The man was furious, Tony. He’s… Dangerous. And his wife isn’t much different. We have to be careful, for y/n sake.”

“I know. We will.” Tony says with intensity, and Matt knew that he meant it.

He leans back in the chair again and smiled. “What are you waiting for? Go get her.”

Tony smiles and almost ran out of the room.

“Friday, if someone asks for me, tell them what happened. Oh! And thank Matt for me.”

“Got it, Boss.” Friday replies with a cheerful voice.

Tony would finally see you again and be able to protect you.

How could he ever think of leaving you in the hands of strangers? He couldn’t imagine their lives without you now. Or no monopoly afternoons, or movie nights with Pepper, Peter and you. Life before the arrival of the sweet, quiet girl who arrived at Tony’s house weeks ago seemed distant and unreal to him. 

He parks out in front of the large house and took a deep breath. It’s big and comfortable. It’s a good place for you but, it isn’t right.

He stepped out of the car and walks towards the front door. He pauses for a moment, holding his breath, and then knocks on the door.

Seconds passes before a blond woman with kind eyes opens the door.  A shocked expression spread across her face.

“Good afternoon, Mrs. Lopez. I’m here to bring Hope home.” Tony says with a kind smile as he saw the woman’s expression change to relief.

“Oh, thank God!” Natalie says as she brings her hands to her chest.

“Why? What’s wrong with her?” Tony smile rapidly fades away to a  worried expression.

“She won’t eat or leave her room, ..  she’s so sad… And I don’t know what to do.” She says with a guilty expression.

“Take me to her.” Tony says, entering in the house.

They walks in silence until they reaches your door’s. Natalie opens it slowly and sighs sadly upon seeing that the food she brought earlier was still there, untouched. She stepped aside to let Tony enter the room..

“Y/n? There’s someone here to see you.”

You suddenly froze. It was Arthur, wasn’t it? He would take you. He would hurt you again.

“Hey there.” Tony says lightly as he walks towards you slowly.

You’re sure it’s your mind tricking you. You’re hallucinating. Mr. Stark wasn’t there. The moment you turn around, it was going to be Arthur standing there with that smile.

I’m fucked.

You turn around and look at him, blinking to make the vision disappear. 

But it didn’t. 

Tony is there looking at you with a worried expression. The relief you felt was so strong that you feel tears coming almost immediately.

You run to him so fast you stumbled a bit, but Tony knelt down and caught you up in a hug which prevented you from falling

“You’re okay. You’re fine. I’ve got you. I’m here.” Tony keep repeating like a mantra in your ear, and without even realising it, you started to cry.

“Oh, baby girl.” Tony’s voice broke, his heart too. He couldn’t tell whether it was fear or your crying causing you to shake, but either way, he could feel how scared you’re. “I’m right here. I promised you, didn’t I? We going home.”   

I was so scared. I thought you would leave me. I thought that I never would see you again. I thought I would have to live with him. I thought that I would be alone again. I don’t wanna be alone anymore. Please.

You let out a small sob as you tried to breathe properly.

He took the rope with a ghostly smile on his face.

It didn’t take long for Tony to realise what was happening; You’re having a panic attack again. The realisation made Tony’s heart ache even more.

The ropes tightened around your wrists, making tears form in your eyes.

“Hey, hey kid.” Tony tried to push you an arm’s-length away, just enough to look at you, but you hold him right back.

She couldn’t make any noise. She had to stay quiet and tolerate the pain in complete silence.

“Y/n, I just want to look at you. Let me look at you kiddo.” Tony asks gently in your ear.

He left the room, leaving her there with her wrists tied and sore. God knows how long she would be there. And it hurts

“Kid, it’s not real. Whatever you’re reliving it’s not real. You’re okay. You’re with me. And you’re safe.” Tony tries to calm you down but you can’t hear him. Or breathe.

You can’t breathe. All you’re feeling was the tight ropes around you, and it hurt and you can’t breathe.

Why you can’t breathe? Why did it seem like your lungs are gone?

“Hey, hey. No. Stay with me. You’re not going to pass out on me. Breathe with me kiddo, come on. You can do it.” Tony takes a few deep exaggerated breaths for you copy.

Pass out?

Just then you realise you’re seeing black dots in the corners of your vision and your head seemed heavy, and you still can’t breathe.

“Y/n. Focus on me.” Tony spoke urgently and takes your face in his hands. You try to focus on his worried expression in front of you, but it was getting fuzzy around the edges.  

“Breathe, kiddo. Slowly. It’s okay. It’s okay now. I promise.”

It wasn’t working. Tony’s concern and the ache on his heart was only growing.

“I know you wanna go home kid, so help me, okay? You’ve got to breathe. They probably won’t let me carry you out of here unconscious.” he tried to joke. Like they could stop me if I had to.

Home.

You’re going home.

You finally found his gaze, seeing how desperate he looked.

“Breathe.” Tony said again and let out an exaggerated breath for you to copy.

In.

“We gonna play Monopoly again.”

Out.

“What movie do you wanna watch? I know Peter made you addicted to Star Wars too.”

In.

“You don’t know how much everybody misses you.”

Out. 

“That’s right kiddo. You’re doing great.”

Do it again.

Tony let out a sigh of relief when he sees you breathing normally, looking at youi with kind eyes.

“You scared me there for a second.” He tried to joke again, taking a deep breath.

You look at him, still holding him tightly.

“You okay? Ready to go home?” He asks brushing your hair away from your face.

You nods, feeling the exhaustion starting to get to you.

He get up holding your hand and helps you to stay on your feet. He quickly thanked Natalie, holding you by your shoulders and led you out of the house.

Tony helps you get in the car and walks around to the driver side. He fastened his seat belt while watching you closely. You looked exhausted.

“You okay?”

You nods and leans your head against the window of the car, too tired to open your eyes. Your body shivered as a chill ran up your spine.

Tony noticed the shiver and reached for the temperature dial on the dashboard. “Are you cold?” He asks, narrowing his eyes.

You nodded again.

Tony took off his jacket and spread it over you like a blanket.  

“Better?”

You give a small nod, almost asleep.

The relief that Tony felt no long ago, was replaced with worry as he started to drive home. The whole way to the Tower he was taking worried glances at you. You shivered from time to time and looked too pale for Tony’s liking.

He parked the car in the Tower’s underground garage and looks over at you.

“Y/n?” He called softly. “Kid, wake up. We’re here.” He touches your shoulder lightly, but you just made a noise and turns your face further into the door of the car. .

Tony signs. “I think I’ll have to carry you after all.”

He opens his door, got out, and walks to your side. He opens the door slowly, with his hand read to catch your head which had been leaning on the window. He looped one arm around your shoulders, the other under your knees, and lifted you out of the car. Tony kicked the door shut with his heel and gripped you more securely as you shifts in his arms.

“Well, I definitely can feel my age now, huh?” He mutters to himself, as he walks to the door and stepped into the elevator.

“Good afternoon, boss. Where would you like me to take you?” Friday asks.

“Y/n’s room, Fri. Quickly.” He says, looking down at you.

“Mr. Rogers requires your presence in the living room, boss.”

“Later, Friday.”  

The elevator ascended quickly, and soon you two are in your room.

He lays you on the bed and carefully covers you with warm blankets, looking at you for a moment.

She’s home. Finally. Tony thought. Everything would be fine now.

But that thought didn’t stay for long.

You shiver on your blanked, and Tony’s concern grew.

He sit on your bed and gently places his palm in your forehead, feeling the warmth and the sweat forming on your forehead.

“Shit. Friday, what’s Y/n’s temperature?”

“Y/n’s temperature it’s currely of 103.5”

Shit. Shit. Shit. Shit.

“Friday, call Bruce, tell him to get here. Now.” Tony says, throwing another blanket over you.

“It’s okay, honey. You’re gonna be okay.” Tony sit on your bed and watchs you. Your hair was sticking to your pale forehead and you breathing sounds raspy.

“Tony?” Tony hears Bruce at the door. “Tony, what’s wrong?”

Tony looks over at Bruce with concerned eyes.

“Y/n. She… She’s sick. Fever of 103,5.”

Bruce came closer and looks at you, his professional side kicking in.

“Anything else?”

“I don't… I don’t know. The lady who was with her said that she wasn’t eating or leaving her room or… Bruce do something.” Tony asks, worry evident in his voice.

“Okay, Tony. You need to calm down. I think she’s only dehydrated.” Bruce says.  He hold your wrist to take your pulse and waited a few seconds. “She’s kinda fast and thready. I think it’s best if we put her on an IV and give her fluids. I don’t know how long she went without eating or drinking anything. Let’s take her to the medlab.”

Tony nods and picks you up in the arms again. Bruce helped with the blankets, and they walked towards the medlab.

Tony placed you on the hospital bed and stepped back to let Bruce work. Tony sits in the chair next to the bed and watched Bruce hang up bags of fluid. He winced when Bruce slid the IV needle into the top of your hand.  

“She’s getting normal saline, D5W, and RL She should be fine.” Bruce says while taping the IV in place. .

“English, Bruce?”

“Saline, sugar, and salts. She’ll be fine Tony.”  

Tony let out a deep breath and nods.

“The team is waiting in the living room, Tony. They wanna know what’s happened.”

Tony looks at Hope and then to Bruce.

“Friday, let me know if anything changes with her, okay?”

“Sure thing, boss.” Friday said and he get up, still looking at you.

“Let’s go, Bruce.”

They walked together in silence until they entered the living room and questions erupted from the team. 

“Where is she?” Loki stood up and asked.

“Is she okay?” Bucky asked.

“Are they gonna let us keep her?” Peter questioned.

“How is she Tony?” Pepper came close and took his hands.

“Let him speak guys.” Steve got up and raised his hand up to call for silence. The team settled.  Steve crossed his arms. “How is she Tony?”

“She’s home.” Tony let out a deep breath. “She’s fine, just a little sick and dehydrated, nothing big. They’ll let us keep her long enough to investigate her father and she’ll have to go to school and try to have a normal life with us.”

“We’ll support you.” Wanda said without hesitation. “We’ll do everything we can to help you and her.”

“She’s right. We’re a team and we’ll work through this together.” Nat said looking confidently at him.

“Y/n is a good kid. Of course we’re gonna help.” Clint said with soft eyes and a smile.

Tony looked at each one of them and smiled, finally feeling what he hadn’t felt in a long time.

Supported.

“Thanks guys. I… I really appreciate it.”

“Tony.” Matt interrupts him with a serious face that took Tony smile away. “I have to warn you, that guy, her father, he’s not a good person.”

“Yeah. Tell about it. How could a man who tortures his little girl be a good person.” Tony says with a cold voice.

“Torture?” Matt raises an eyebrow.

“Bucky told me he saw marks on Hope’s arms, and that he knew what caused those kinds of marks. It’s a kind of torture with ropes… God, I don’t wanna imagine what else this kid suffered.” Tony closes his eyes, trying not to think about his kid crying in pain at Arthur’s hands.

“That’ll be good for the court proceedings” Matt says as he nodded. “But that’s not what I’m talking about. The man was furious, Tony. He’s… Dangerous. And his wife isn’t much different. We have to be careful, for y/n sake.”

“I know. We will.” Tony says with intensity, and Matt knew that he meant it.

He leans back in the chair again and smiled. “What are you waiting for? Go get her.”

Tony smiles and almost ran out of the room.

“Friday, if someone asks for me, tell them what happened. Oh! And thank Matt for me.”

“Got it, Boss.” Friday replies with a cheerful voice.

Tony would finally see you again and be able to protect you.

How could he ever think of leaving you in the hands of strangers? He couldn’t imagine their lives without you now. Or no monopoly afternoons, or movie nights with Pepper, Peter and you. Life before the arrival of the sweet, quiet girl who arrived at Tony’s house weeks ago seemed distant and unreal to him. 

He parks out in front of the large house and took a deep breath. It’s big and comfortable. It’s a good place for you but, it isn’t right.

He stepped out of the car and walks towards the front door. He pauses for a moment, holding his breath, and then knocks on the door.

Seconds passes before a blond woman with kind eyes opens the door.  A shocked expression spread across her face.

“Good afternoon, Mrs. Lopez. I’m here to bring Hope home.” Tony says with a kind smile as he saw the woman’s expression change to relief.

“Oh, thank God!” Natalie says as she brings her hands to her chest.

“Why? What’s wrong with her?” Tony smile rapidly fades away to a  worried expression.

“She won’t eat or leave her room, ..  she’s so sad… And I don’t know what to do.” She says with a guilty expression.

“Take me to her.” Tony says, entering in the house.

They walks in silence until they reaches your door’s. Natalie opens it slowly and sighs sadly upon seeing that the food she brought earlier was still there, untouched. She stepped aside to let Tony enter the room..

“Y/n? There’s someone here to see you.”

You suddenly froze. It was Arthur, wasn’t it? He would take you. He would hurt you again.

“Hey there.” Tony says lightly as he walks towards you slowly.

You’re sure it’s your mind tricking you. You’re hallucinating. Mr. Stark wasn’t there. The moment you turn around, it was going to be Arthur standing there with that smile.

I’m fucked.

You turn around and look at him, blinking to make the vision disappear. 

But it didn’t. 

Tony is there looking at you with a worried expression. The relief you felt was so strong that you feel tears coming almost immediately.

You run to him so fast you stumbled a bit, but Tony knelt down and caught you up in a hug which prevented you from falling

“You’re okay. You’re fine. I’ve got you. I’m here.” Tony keep repeating like a mantra in your ear, and without even realising it, you started to cry.

“Oh, baby girl.” Tony’s voice broke, his heart too. He couldn’t tell whether it was fear or your crying causing you to shake, but either way, he could feel how scared you’re. “I’m right here. I promised you, didn’t I? We going home.”   

I was so scared. I thought you would leave me. I thought that I never would see you again. I thought I would have to live with him. I thought that I would be alone again. I don’t wanna be alone anymore. Please.

You let out a small sob as you tried to breathe properly.

He took the rope with a ghostly smile on his face.

It didn’t take long for Tony to realise what was happening; You’re having a panic attack again. The realisation made Tony’s heart ache even more.

The ropes tightened around your wrists, making tears form in your eyes.

“Hey, hey kid.” Tony tried to push you an arm’s-length away, just enough to look at you, but you hold him right back.

She couldn’t make any noise. She had to stay quiet and tolerate the pain in complete silence.

“Y/n, I just want to look at you. Let me look at you kiddo.” Tony asks gently in your ear.

He left the room, leaving her there with her wrists tied and sore. God knows how long she would be there. And it hurts

“Kid, it’s not real. Whatever you’re reliving it’s not real. You’re okay. You’re with me. And you’re safe.” Tony tries to calm you down but you can’t hear him. Or breathe.

You can’t breathe. All you’re feeling was the tight ropes around you, and it hurt and you can’t breathe.

Why you can’t breathe? Why did it seem like your lungs are gone?

“Hey, hey. No. Stay with me. You’re not going to pass out on me. Breathe with me kiddo, come on. You can do it.” Tony takes a few deep exaggerated breaths for you copy.

Pass out?

Just then you realise you’re seeing black dots in the corners of your vision and your head seemed heavy, and you still can’t breathe.

“Y/n. Focus on me.” Tony spoke urgently and takes your face in his hands. You try to focus on his worried expression in front of you, but it was getting fuzzy around the edges.  

“Breathe, kiddo. Slowly. It’s okay. It’s okay now. I promise.”

It wasn’t working. Tony’s concern and the ache on his heart was only growing.

“I know you wanna go home kid, so help me, okay? You’ve got to breathe. They probably won’t let me carry you out of here unconscious.” he tried to joke. Like they could stop me if I had to.

Home.

You’re going home.

You finally found his gaze, seeing how desperate he looked.

“Breathe.” Tony said again and let out an exaggerated breath for you to copy.

In.

“We gonna play Monopoly again.”

Out.

“What movie do you wanna watch? I know Peter made you addicted to Star Wars too.”

In.

“You don’t know how much everybody misses you.”

Out. 

“That’s right kiddo. You’re doing great.”

Do it again.

Tony let out a sigh of relief when he sees you breathing normally, looking at youi with kind eyes.

“You scared me there for a second.” He tried to joke again, taking a deep breath.

You look at him, still holding him tightly.

“You okay? Ready to go home?” He asks brushing your hair away from your face.

You nods, feeling the exhaustion starting to get to you.

He get up holding your hand and helps you to stay on your feet. He quickly thanked Natalie, holding you by your shoulders and led you out of the house.

Tony helps you get in the car and walks around to the driver side. He fastened his seat belt while watching you closely. You looked exhausted.

“You okay?”

You nods and leans your head against the window of the car, too tired to open your eyes. Your body shivered as a chill ran up your spine.

Tony noticed the shiver and reached for the temperature dial on the dashboard. “Are you cold?” He asks, narrowing his eyes.

You nodded again.

Tony took off his jacket and spread it over you like a blanket.  

“Better?”

You give a small nod, almost asleep.

The relief that Tony felt no long ago, was replaced with worry as he started to drive home. The whole way to the Tower he was taking worried glances at you. You shivered from time to time and looked too pale for Tony’s liking.

He parked the car in the Tower’s underground garage and looks over at you.

“Y/n?” He called softly. “Kid, wake up. We’re here.” He touches your shoulder lightly, but you just made a noise and turns your face further into the door of the car. .

Tony signs. “I think I’ll have to carry you after all.”

He opens his door, got out, and walks to your side. He opens the door slowly, with his hand read to catch your head which had been leaning on the window. He looped one arm around your shoulders, the other under your knees, and lifted you out of the car. Tony kicked the door shut with his heel and gripped you more securely as you shifts in his arms.

“Well, I definitely can feel my age now, huh?” He mutters to himself, as he walks to the door and stepped into the elevator.

“Good afternoon, boss. Where would you like me to take you?” Friday asks.

“Y/n’s room, Fri. Quickly.” He says, looking down at you.

“Mr. Rogers requires your presence in the living room, boss.”

“Later, Friday.”  

The elevator ascended quickly, and soon you two are in your room.

He lays you on the bed and carefully covers you with warm blankets, looking at you for a moment.

She’s home. Finally. Tony thought. Everything would be fine now.

But that thought didn’t stay for long.

You shiver on your blanked, and Tony’s concern grew.

He sit on your bed and gently places his palm in your forehead, feeling the warmth and the sweat forming on your forehead.

“Shit. Friday, what’s Y/n’s temperature?”

“Y/n’s temperature it’s currely of 103.5”

Shit. Shit. Shit. Shit.

“Friday, call Bruce, tell him to get here. Now.” Tony says, throwing another blanket over you.

“It’s okay, honey. You’re gonna be okay.” Tony sit on your bed and watchs you. Your hair was sticking to your pale forehead and you breathing sounds raspy.

“Tony?” Tony hears Bruce at the door. “Tony, what’s wrong?”

Tony looks over at Bruce with concerned eyes.

“Y/n. She… She’s sick. Fever of 103,5.”

Bruce came closer and looks at you, his professional side kicking in.

“Anything else?”

“I don't… I don’t know. The lady who was with her said that she wasn’t eating or leaving her room or… Bruce do something.” Tony asks, worry evident in his voice.

“Okay, Tony. You need to calm down. I think she’s only dehydrated.” Bruce says.  He hold your wrist to take your pulse and waited a few seconds. “She’s kinda fast and thready. I think it’s best if we put her on an IV and give her fluids. I don’t know how long she went without eating or drinking anything. Let’s take her to the medlab.”

Tony nods and picks you up in the arms again. Bruce helped with the blankets, and they walked towards the medlab.

Tony placed you on the hospital bed and stepped back to let Bruce work. Tony sits in the chair next to the bed and watched Bruce hang up bags of fluid. He winced when Bruce slid the IV needle into the top of your hand.  

“She’s getting normal saline, D5W, and RL She should be fine.” Bruce says while taping the IV in place. .

“English, Bruce?”

“Saline, sugar, and salts. She’ll be fine Tony.”  

Tony let out a deep breath and nods.

“The team is waiting in the living room, Tony. They wanna know what’s happened.”

Tony looks at Hope and then to Bruce.

“Friday, let me know if anything changes with her, okay?”

“Sure thing, boss.” Friday said and he get up, still looking at you.

“Let’s go, Bruce.”

They walked together in silence until they entered the living room and questions erupted from the team. 

“Where is she?” Loki stood up and asked.

“Is she okay?” Bucky asked.

“Are they gonna let us keep her?” Peter questioned.

“How is she Tony?” Pepper came close and took his hands.

“Let him speak guys.” Steve got up and raised his hand up to call for silence. The team settled.  Steve crossed his arms. “How is she Tony?”

“She’s home.” Tony let out a deep breath. “She’s fine, just a little sick and dehydrated, nothing big. They’ll let us keep her long enough to investigate her father and she’ll have to go to school and try to have a normal life with us.”

“We’ll support you.” Wanda said without hesitation. “We’ll do everything we can to help you and her.”

“She’s right. We’re a team and we’ll work through this together.” Nat said looking confidently at him.

“Y/n is a good kid. Of course we’re gonna help.” Clint said with soft eyes and a smile.

Tony looked at each one of them and smiled, finally feeling what he hadn’t felt in a long time.

Supported.

“Thanks guys. I… I really appreciate it.”

But most of all, you’re scared. What if Mr. Stark didn’t want you and you would have to live with Arthur and Elizabeth again? You wouldn’t even get in the front door before they would you for escaping and ending up living with the avengers of all people.

You sighs and looks at your watch. Friday hadn’t spoken to you since, but the watch are still working. If it wasn’t for that, you could swear it was all just a dream. You would swear you never had a family again.

The truth is, you’re starting to doubt, and it sucks because maybe the feelings they had for you was just pity. Maybe they never saw you as you saw them. Maybe you just made yourself a fool again, maybe you was nothing but the homeless and starving girl Loki found. You couldn’t help but start to feel tears coming.

The pain is so strong and you missed them so much, it seemed it would kill you.  All you wanted was to go back and play Monopoly and have movie nights with them. Hear Peter talk about Star Wars and spend almost all night with Mr. Stark in the lab, hearing him murmur a song that Friday was playing, too concentrated on what he was doing to notice you hiding a smile. Or even stay up reading with Pepper or see Loki’s magic and learn self-defence with Buck.

Bucky.

You touches the bracelet he gave you, feeling a tear fall.

This will protect me.

“Y/N?” you hear Natalie, the woman you’re staying with, knock on the door. “I brought you lunch.”

You don’t move from the window you’re sitting in, just looking at the heavy clouds of the storm that was about to come.

Natalie peeks in with her head and looks at the sad girl watching the rain. She enters, biting her lip and put the tray on the table and walked towards you.

“Hi.”

You don’t move.

“I made chicken…” still no response. “Aren’t you hungry? You didn’t eat anything since yesterday… you’ll end up sick.”

She sit next to you looking for the your eyes. “Or maybe get out of this room? You’ve just stayed  here since you arrived… Earth to Hope…are you in there?” She waves her hand lightly in front of your face. Nothing. She shifts in the same spot, still biting her lips. “Look… I know you’re sad and you miss… them, but you can’t stay like this honey…”

You don’t move, just keep sitting there, and with that light, you look almost lifeless.

“Okay…” Natalie says, giving up on trying to get something from you. “I’ll leave the plate here. If you want something… Just… Just let me know.”

She walks slowly to the door, and, before she closed it she looks at you again.

You really seems like a ghost.

Tony hate to wait. It’s out of his control and he hate it.

“Okay. I’m listening.”

Tony didn’t wanted to imagine how Bucky knew this, or how you got those.

Bucky looks into Tony’s eyes and see that he meant it. He wouldn’t let you, and that was enough for him.

“Okay.” Bucky says, nodding.

Bucky stays there just for another minute before he get up and starts to walk away.

“Barnes?” Tony calls and Bucky turns around. “I’m glad she talked to you.”

Bucky just smiles and nods, walking away right after.

Yeah, maybe they would heal.

“Y/n’s temperature it’s currely of 103.5”

Shit. Shit. Shit. Shit.

“Friday, call Bruce, tell him to get here. Now.” Tony says, throwing another blanket over you.

“It’s okay, honey. You’re gonna be okay.” Tony sit on your bed and watchs you. Your hair was sticking to your pale forehead and you breathing sounds raspy.

“Tony?” Tony hears Bruce at the door. “Tony, what’s wrong?”

Tony looks over at Bruce with concerned eyes.

“Y/n. She… She’s sick. Fever of 103,5.”

Bruce came closer and looks at you, his professional side kicking in.

“Anything else?”

“I don't… I don’t know. The lady who was with her said that she wasn’t eating or leaving her room or… Bruce do something.” Tony asks, worry evident in his voice.

“Okay, Tony. You need to calm down. I think she’s only dehydrated.” Bruce says.  He hold your wrist to take your pulse and waited a few seconds. “She’s kinda fast and thready. I think it’s best if we put her on an IV and give her fluids. I don’t know how long she went without eating or drinking anything. Let’s take her to the medlab.”

Tony nods and picks you up in the arms again. Bruce helped with the blankets, and they walked towards the medlab.

Tony placed you on the hospital bed and stepped back to let Bruce work. Tony sits in the chair next to the bed and watched Bruce hang up bags of fluid. He winced when Bruce slid the IV needle into the top of your hand.  

“She’s getting normal saline, D5W, and RL She should be fine.” Bruce says while taping the IV in place. .

“English, Bruce?”

“Saline, sugar, and salts. She’ll be fine Tony.”  

Tony let out a deep breath and nods.

“The team is waiting in the living room, Tony. They wanna know what’s happened.”

Tony looks at Hope and then to Bruce.

“Friday, let me know if anything changes with her, okay?”

“Sure thing, boss.” Friday said and he get up, still looking at you.

“Let’s go, Bruce.”

They walked together in silence until they entered the living room and questions erupted from the team. 

“Where is she?” Loki stood up and asked.

“Is she okay?” Bucky asked.

“Are they gonna let us keep her?” Peter questioned.

“How is she Tony?” Pepper came close and took his hands.

“Let him speak guys.” Steve got up and raised his hand up to call for silence. The team settled.  Steve crossed his arms. “How is she Tony?”

“She’s home.” Tony let out a deep breath. “She’s fine, just a little sick and dehydrated, nothing big. They’ll let us keep her long enough to investigate her father and she’ll have to go to school and try to have a normal life with us.”

“We’ll support you.” Wanda said without hesitation. “We’ll do everything we can to help you and her.”

“She’s right. We’re a team and we’ll work through this together.” Nat said looking confidently at him.

“Y/n is a good kid. Of course we’re gonna help.” Clint said with soft eyes and a smile.

Tony looked at each one of them and smiled, finally feeling what he hadn’t felt in a long time.

Supported.

“Thanks guys. I… I really appreciate it.”

You didn’t remember the last time you felt so alone. It had been five days, and Mr. Stark hadn’t spoken to you since then. Part of you knew he couldn’t, the lawyer you forgot the name of told you that you couldn’t speak with Mr. Stark for a while because that could “interfere in the proceedings”.

But most of all, you’re scared. What if Mr. Stark didn’t want you and you would have to live with Arthur and Elizabeth again? You wouldn’t even get in the front door before they would you for escaping and ending up living with the avengers of all people.

You sighs and looks at your watch. Friday hadn’t spoken to you since, but the watch are still working. If it wasn’t for that, you could swear it was all just a dream. You would swear you never had a family again.

summary: Ironstrange “I Love You” #17 - Because of a Skill
title: Ironstrange “I Love You” #17 - Because of a Skill
body:
Tony stares whenever Stephen does magic, and Stephen watches Tony work his own magic with the same awe. “It’s not the same,” Tony says, and Stephen can’t help shake his head. It isn’t the same, sure, but it’s still amazing.

He doesn’t go into the lab too often, because he doesn’t want to bother the genius at work. Of course, when Tony’s really working, he wouldn’t notice an explosion. No, really, he has missed one of those before…

When he does go into the lab, though, he sees something beautiful.

Tony is hunched over one of the robots, working on a piece of the robot’s…arm. It’s hard to say exactly what the appendage is, but Stephen’s pretty sure arm is the right word. “Now, c’mon let’s see, what have we got here… You really busted it, buddy.”

The robot whirs and beeps a soft sound.

“It’s alright,” Tony grumbles. “I got the answer to your problem, thankfully.”

Tony made a few adjustments with a screwdriver, and then went over to a computer where he typed a few things down. Stephen starred with the expression of someone head-over-heels in love.

“Yes, Doctor?” Tony asks, without looking up.

“I love you.”

summary: Ironstrange “I Love You” #16 - Because of a Wedding
title: Ironstrange “I Love You” #16 - Because of a Wedding
body:
To say the wedding is surreal is an understatement. It’s small, it’s muted and yet it is the most magical thing that Tony has experienced in his life - short of his husband himself. In the moments after its completion, it would not be an exaggeration to say that he’s in shock.

“You look like you’re not quite with me,” Stephen says. His expression is light, soft, as if all the pressures Stephen endures on the daily have just floated away. “Where’s your mind at, dear husband of mine?”

The word husband is delicious and Tony relishes in the taste. He had never imagined someone would call him husband and he decides, instantly, that he likes it.

“This is surreal.”

Stephen takes hold of his hand. His grasp is not usually so firm. “No,” he says with a slight quirk of his eyebrow. “It’s not.”

“It’s not?” Tony asks.

“No,” Stephen explains. “I’ve spent the last few years seeing every surreal thing there was to see. This is very much real.”

“Sarcastic asshole.” Tony grins. “I love you.”

summary: Funny story, I've seen Iron Man 1 and 3 but never 2. It's been a while since I saw either, but I want to watch 2. Do I have to...
question: Funny story, I've seen Iron Man 1 and 3 but never 2. It's been a while since I saw either, but I want to watch 2. Do I have to rewatch, or can I just head in on 2?
answer:
Thank you so much for the ask, sweet anon! ❤️


All of the Iron Man movies have a special place in my heart, but I really love Iron Man 2. It’s considered by many to be the weakest of the trilogy, but while we get to see the very beginning of Tony’s redemption arc in the original Iron Man and his struggle with anxiety and PTSD in IM3, IM2 shows a great deal of Tony’s character as well. His struggle with the fact that he’s slowly being poisoned to death by the very thing he’s using to keep himself alive is so well done, including his attempt to push away those closest to him in his misguided thought that they would then grieve for him less once he was gone.

Plus we get to see the introduction of Black Widow, and a tiny Peter Parker makes his first appearance in the MCU. ❤️

As for rewatching, if you’ve seen Iron Man recently it’s not necessary to rewatch it prior to watching IM2. IM2 takes place about six months following the ending of Iron Man, and overlaps with events that occur in The Incredible Hulk and Thor.


That was probably a lot longer answer than was necessary, but I’ve never been known for giving quick answers to simple questions! 😉 🤓 I’d love to hear what you think once you watch! ❤️

title: Coffee & Books (book 1) - Loki fanfic
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2UcmQF8

by ilse_writes

The people of Asgard are looking for a new home. They get a warm welcome on Earth, except for Loki. He is treated like a criminal of war, a terrorist. All they see in him is darkness. But there is a light, if she is up for the task.

Fragment:
At that moment, the door to the apartment swings open and a man barges in. He is holding something that looks like a big syringe in his hands. “Yoohoo… Reindeer games! You home? I’ve got something for you!”
The man stops in his tracks when he spots us sitting on the couch. “I’m sorry, I didn’t realise we had company. And beautiful company at that, I might say. What’s your name, beautiful? Do you have clearance? Williams, does she have clearance?”
[…]
From the corner of my eye I can see that Loki has turned his chair to face the room, watching the exchange between me and Tony Stark with a hint of a smile on his face. I get the sense that there’s not much that gets past the Trickster.
Mr. Stark has already moved on, walking towards Loki. He is holding up the syringe like it’s a Super Soaker gun, waving it back and forth. “This will only hurt a little, Bambi!” Tony laughs.

First published February 2018 on Wattpad.

summary: Think Again (When You Stop Freaking Out)
title: Think Again (When You Stop Freaking Out)
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2DutvoJ

by Anika_Ann

Steve Rogers thought that seeing the aliens raining from the sky would be the craziest thing he had ever seen and nothing would top that.

Matt Murdock, on the other hand, was pretty sure he would never see anything again – after all, he had been blind for the past two decades.

Looks like they both needed to think again.

Well, that is after they get over the fact that something is seriously messed up here.

title: Battle Scars
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2T4KSSs

by invisame

You live in a world where soulmates share each other’s scars. Like most, you bore the typical minor wounds that barely even caught your attention. Until the day a large scar appears in the center of your chest. And this is no ordinary scar.

Finding your soulmate is one thing. Admitting to him who you are is quite another.

summary: After Thor uses Stormbreaker to open the Bifrost and save my starvin’ lil boi; Tony makes adjustments to the voice activation...
body:
After Thor uses Stormbreaker to open the Bifrost and save my starvin’ lil boi; Tony makes adjustments to the voice activation whatever thing; adding Scott Lang is now The Strongest Avenger™ and  Bruce is“Banner”

The Hulk is just “Green Banner”

Many arguments later, he finally changes Scott’s name to World’s Best Grandma.

Thor stays “Point Break” and sulks for a week over not getting The Strongest Avenger™
